newsitem.title: PERU: Peru sees at least five percent growth in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Peru sees at least five percent growth in 1997.

text.p: Peruvian Economy Minister Jorge Camet said the country would register five percent growth at worst this year if the El Nino weather phenomenon causes damage to the economy.
"In the worst case, we should grow five percent," Camet said in a television interview late Sunday. "That is a ministry calculation for the setbacks El Nino can cause."

The El Nino phenomenon, caused by warm waters in the Pacific, is expected to cause droughts in the south and flooding in the north later this year. Peru's gross domestic product grew 2.8 percent last year.
Camet also said details of a controversial debt buyback, prior to Peru's Brady Plan debt negotiations which wound up in March, would be announced within 30 days.
"The debt buyback was carried out in silence because these operations always annoy creditors a lot. The Banco de la Nacion carried out the operation with advice from the Economy Ministry," he said.
